abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Irrigation Dam
            Safety Project for Armenia were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and the borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) to
            find a problem in a dam, how to qualify the problem, and how
            to propose measures to improve dam safety, are all difficult
            tasks and need a lot of experience. Many times it needs to
            rely mostly on international experience and also to carry
            out detailed geotechnical investigations and field
            inspection and testing; 2) it is usual that some of the
            originally proposed design solutions may change during
            construction as a result of more detailed investigations; 3)
            training is essential for the staff of the Project
            Implementation Unit (PIU) and Water Supply Agency (WSA) on
            dam safety aspects especially as this is a very specialized
            field; 4) establishing a separate dam agency for Operation
            and Maintenance (O&M) or a special unit within the WSA
            is preferable because dam O&M is a very specialized
            operation which requires experience and high professional
            skills; and 5) improvements on dam management and on
            optimizing of water utilization, is still needed in the
            country. This would involve computer based operation and
            management, and may be, construction of new dams, especially
            on the rivers which have the potential for cascade dams.
            This can be subject to a new follow up project which at
            least look at the optimization aspects of operation and
            management of existing dams and further strengthening the
            management of the country dams.
